byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting from Washington and Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco.

abstract: Disclosures by Federal Bureau of Investigation and Justice Dept suggest  controversial legal battle with Apple to open its iPhone has led to flurry of third-party efforts by hackers to crack phone's security; hearing in case has been postponed while FBI investigates alternative methods of getting into device.
lead_paragraph: The prominence of the case has stimulated people worldwide to try to get into the device, and now the government has to check out their ideas.

headline.main: F.B.I. Clash With Apple Loosed a Torrent of Possible Ways to Hack an iPhone
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Clash With Apple Loosed a Torrent of Hacking Methods for an iPhone

snippet: The prominence of the case has stimulated people worldwide to try to get into the device, and now the government has to check out their ideas.
